Perhaps you are right about the Meiji Period...  But I still find it a rath=
er boring period when compared to everything  that happened before and afte=
r. Of course, the revolution itself was  quite exciting in my mind. The inf=
ormation about this period is not  only sparse on this board, but in schola=
rship in general (for the  reasons you mentioned). There are more books on =
WWII than I care to  know about, and the same could be said of pre-Meiji Ja=
pan. However, I  do wish my local university had a class on the Russo-Japan=
ese War--a  very under-rated war in terms of significance. 
  
  Jonathan E=
llgen

tokyo dog <tokyodog@...> wrote:I=E2=80=99m  no expert in Japan h=
istory, but I=E2=80=99ve noticed quite a few historical  inaccuracies poste=

nd questions. I thought it might be helpful  if I posted some comments, and=
 some history books for people to read,  for those who might be interested.=
